results.title: «سيسكو القابضة» تتحول للخسارة بـ0.74 مليون ريال بنهاية 2024
creator: اليوم - الدمام
results.description: تحولت شركة البنى التحتية المستدامة القابضة (سيسكو القابضة) للخسارة في عام 2024 مسجلة صافي خسارة قدرها 0.74 مليون ريال، مقابل أرباح بقيمة 71.2 مليون ريال في 2023.ووفقا لبيان الشركة على تداول السعودية، تعود الخسارة إلى العوامل التالية:- تراجع حصة الأرباح من الشركات الزميلة المحتسبة بحقوق الملكية، وذلك نتيجة صافي خسارة غير مكررة لمرة واحدة ناتجة عن مخصص لمرة واحدة (إجمالي 68 مليون ريال، تبلغ حصة سيسكو منه 34 مليون ريال) لتغطية تكاليف إضافية في ثلاثة مشاريع EPC (الهندسة والمشتريات وأعمال الإنشاء)، إضافةً إلى خسارة إجمالية غير مكررة لمرة واحدة في شركة جرين دوم، إحدى الشركات الزميلة المحتسبة بحقوق الملكية، بقيمة 12 مليون ريال لعام 2024.- زيادة تكاليف الاستثمار والتشغيل الأولية لمحطة حاويات باتينغا في بنغلاديش، التي بدأت عملياتها التشغيلية في عام 2024.- ارتفاع مصاريف الإهلاك المرتبطة بالاستثمارات الرأسمالية الجديدة، مما أثر على الربحية.- زيادة تكاليف التشغيل والرسوم المالية.- مخصص لمرة واحدة للزكاة بمبلغ 17.4 مليون ريال عن العامين الماليين 2021 و2022، ومخصص إضافي للزكاة بمبلغ 9.0 مليون ريال عن العام المالي 2023.

results.title: انخفاض حرارة الجسم..من هم الأشخاص الأكثر عرضة للإصابة بهذه الحالة؟
results.description: تُعد حالة انخفاض حرارة الجسم حالة طبية طارئة تحدث عند انخفاض درجة حرارة الجسم الأساسية إلى ما دون 35 درجة مئوية، حيث تبلغ درجة حرارة الجسم الطبيعية في الحالات العادية حوالي 37 درجة مئوية.

results.title: 10th Shanghai International Machine Tool Exhibition Breaks Records, Celebrates a Decade of Innovation
results.description: SHANGHAI, March 12, 2025 /PRNewswire/ -- The 10th Shanghai International Machine Tool Exhibition (CMES), held from March 3-6, 2025, concluded with record-breaking success, attracting 51,741 professional visitors (excluding exhibitors and staff). Spanning 100,000 square meters, the event reinforced its status as a global hub for the machine tool and manufacturing industries. Show site at CMES Shanghai 2025 Historic Turnout and Industry OptimismThe exhibition drew 326 industry associations and TAP buyer groups, fostering dynamic negotiations and tech exploration. Over 80 industry leaders shared insights across 40 summit forums, covering topics from automation to smart manufacturing. Major media outlets, including CCTV Finance and Tencent, provided extensive coverage, highlighting the event's global significance. With exhibitors quickly depleting materials and attendees forging new connections, the event showcased manufacturing's strong resurgence. Notably, exhibitors exhausted their promotional materials within the first few hours, clearly demonstrating the participants' exceptional engagement levels. This remarkable turnout not only mirrored the manufacturing sector's resurgent optimism but also prompted spontaneous endorsements from participants, with multiple attendees remarking, "This exhibition proves the manufacturing industry is experiencing unprecedented growth!" Cutting-Edge Innovations and Global Collaboration Over 1,200 global brands, including Mazak, Tsugami, and DMG MORI, showcased their latest innovations. Highlights included the debut of Doosan's PUMA 700 XLM series and Mazak's high-speed QTE-200MY L turning center. Significant deals were struck, such as Hebei Daheng Heavy Machinery securing orders worth over 3 million RMB. International buyers from 43 countries participated in a cross-border procurement meeting, underscoring the event's global appeal. Lê Kỳ Nam, Vice President of VAMI expressed: "Most Vietnamese buyers placed orders on-site, reflecting the growing ties between China and Vietnam. I hope our future cooperation extends beyond machinery sales." Celebrating a Decade of ExcellenceThe 10th anniversary featured a grand opening ceremony and the 2025 China Machinery Industry Technology Innovation Leadership Awards, honoring 95 companies for their groundbreaking contributions. Industry leaders like Beijing Jingdiao and Grob were recognized for their advancements. Looking AheadCMES aims to expand its global presence and enhance online-offline integration, fostering innovation and collaboration in the manufacturing sector. The 10th edition was not just a celebration of past achievements but a bold step toward a future of connectivity and technological advancement. We look forward to seeing you next year! About CMES:CHN MACH EXPO (CMES) is a premier machine tool trade fair held annually in 10 Chinese cities.

results.title: أرباح «جروب فايف» تقفز 311% إلى 38.5 مليون ريال في 2024
creator: اليوم - الدمام
results.description: قفزت أرباح شركة جروب فايف السعودية للأنابيب في عام 2024 بنسبة 310.9% إلى 38.5 مليون ريال، مقابل 9.3 مليون ريال في 2023.ووفقا لبيان الشركة على تداول السعودية، يرجع هذا الارتفاع إلى زيادة متوسط أسعار البيع وانخفاض تكاليف الإنتاج.وحققت الشركة إيرادات بلغت 976 مليون ريال للسنة المالية 2024، مقارنةً بإيرادات قدرها 455 مليون ريال للسنة المالية 2023. ويعود ذلك إلى الزيادة في حجم المبيعات وارتفاع متوسط أسعار البيع للطن.وأوصى مجلس إدارة شركة جروب فايف السعودية للأنابيب، أمس، بتوزيع أرباح نقدية على المساهمين عن السنة المالية 2024م.ويبلغ إجمالي المبلغ الموزع 14 مليون ريال، فيما يبلغ عدد الأسهم المستحقة للأرباح 28 مليون ريال.وتبلغ حصة السهم من التوزيع 0.5 ريال لكل سهم، فيما تبلغ نسبة التوزيع إلى قيمة السهم الاسمية 5%.وستكون أحقية توزيعات الأرباح للمساهمين المالكين لأسهم الشركة في نهاية اليوم المحدد للاستحقاق يوم انعقاد الجمعية العامة للشركة (والتي سيتم الإعلان عنها لاحقاً)، والمقيدين في سجل مساهمي الشركة لدى شركة مركز إيداع الأوراق المالية (إيداع)، فيما ستعلن تاريخ التوزيع لاحقا.

results.title: French May Arts Festival 2025 Co-presenting the groundbreaking cross-cultural exhibition 'The Hong Kong Jockey Club Series: Picasso for Asia--A Conversation' with M+
results.description: From March to July, venture along the cultural bridges of East and West and discover a kaleidoscope of more than 60 programmes featuring the best of French art, cinema, circus, music, dance, theatre and gastronomy. HONG KONG, March 12, 2025 /PRNewswire/ -- Supported by The Hong Kong Jockey Club Charities Trust as Major Partner, alongside other patrons and partners, The French May Arts Festival (French May) 2025 is delighted to announce the launch of this year's programmes. Themed 'Vive L'art' – In Art We Live, the 32nd edition of French May is returning with more than 60 arts and cultural programmes spanning art, cinema, circus, music, dance, theatre and gastronomy. Supported by The Hong Kong Jockey Club Charities Trust alongside other patrons and partners, the festival runs from 15 March to 13 July, beginning with the groundbreaking The Hong Kong Jockey Club Series: Picasso for Asia—A Conversation exhibition co-presented with M+. By providing a platform for local and international arts and cultural talent through vibrant cross-cultural collaborations, French May hopes to enrich and enliven audiences with the best of French culture and heritage, bolstering cultural bridges between East and West. Through partnerships with M+, Tai Kwun and others, this year French May is reaching out to touch everything and be everywhere for everyone through the best of French arts and culture. Highlighted programmes include: The Hong Kong Jockey Club Series: Picasso for Asia—A Conversation Co-presented by French May and M+, co-organised by M+ and Musée national Picasso-Paris (MnPP), The Hong Kong Jockey Club Series: Picasso for Asia—A Conversation is the opening programme of the French May Arts Festival 2025. It is generously supported by The Hong Kong Jockey Club Charities Trust as Title Sponsor and financially supported by the Mega Arts and Cultural Events Fund under the Culture, Sports and Tourism Bureau of the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region Government. The exhibition is also among activities marking the 140th anniversary of The Hong Kong Jockey Club. The groundbreaking exhibition brings together more than 60 works by Spanish master Pablo Picasso and over 80 pieces by Asian and Asian-diasporic artists from the M+ Collections. This is the first time that masterpieces from the Musée national Picasso-Paris have been shown in dialogue with a museum collection in Asia. It marks the first major exhibition of Picasso in Hong Kong in more than a decade, examining Picasso's enduring influence in and connections with Asia for the first time. Tickets are now available for purchase. For details, please visit M+ website. Dates: 15 March – 13 July 2025 Venue: West Gallery, M+ French GourMay Food and Wine Festival French GourMay is the only major festival in Hong Kong dedicated to French gastronomy. From 1 to 31 May, discover the diverse world of French spirits. Be it as an ingredient in cooking, as a component in cocktails or as a digestive served after a meal, explore the many faces of French spirits and liquors. Stay tuned for more information on exclusive restaurant and bar offers, retailer promotions, thematic workshops at learning centres and more! Dates: 1 – 31 May 2025 Le Bal Experience the splendour of the Belle Époque period with this fanciful street parade inspired by the works of Pierre-Auguste Renoir and Edgar Degas. Produced by Remue Ménage, a world-renowned French company that marries visual arts with circus, dance and puppetry art, party the night away with magnificent horse-drawn carriages, dancers and acrobats. A signature event of the French Rendezvous@Tai Kwun series. Dates: 9-11, 13-18 May 2025 Venue: Parade Ground, Tai Kwun Gautier Capuçon plays Shostakovich Presented by the Hong Kong Philharmonic Orchestra, catch the debonair French cellist Gautier Capuçon alongside Austrian conductor Christoph Koncz live on stage in a concert that honours a double musical anniversary – of French composer Maurice Ravel's 150th birthday, and Russian composer Dmitri Shostakovich's 50th death. Dates: 8 – 9 May 2025 Venue: Concert Hall, Hong Kong Cultural Centre Trio Wanderer Hong Kong Début Co-presented by the French May Arts Festival and the Hong Kong Sinfonietta, Trio Wanderer will be making their much-anticipated Hong Kong début with a recital of exquisite piano trio classics by Debussy, Ravel and Mendelssohn. They will also join hands with Hong Kong Sinfonietta and Music Director Designate of Prague Symphony Orchestra Tomáš Netopil to present Beethoven's iconic Triple Concerto. Dates: 14 & 17 May 2025 Venue: Concert Hall, Hong Kong City Hall French May Cinema Programme Organised by the Alliance Française de Hong Kong, catch a selection of French films across a wide variety of genres. Check out screenings at designated cinemas on the Broadway Circuit and more. Stay tuned for more details! Dates: 20 May – 4 June 2025 Venues: Broadway Circuit and other cinemas Corps extrêmes Presented by West Kowloon Cultural District, Corps extrêmes (Extreme Bodies) explores the human desire for weightlessness through an exhilarating mix of dance, acrobatics and extreme sports. Intimate yet larger than life, the gravity-defying performance combines projections, spoken word and a musical score, revealing an existential human experience anchored in reality and suspended in the world of dreams. Dates: 30 May – 1 June 2025 Venue: Grand Theatre, Xiqu Centre Giselle Presented by the Hong Kong Ballet (HKB), let HKB's Artistic Director Septime Webre and South African ballet artist Charla Genn take you away on a tale of love, betrayal and redemption in one of the most romantic ballets of all time. Immerse in the poignant story of carefree peasant girl Giselle who unexpectedly falls in love with Albrecht, a flirtatious nobleman in disguise. Featuring brand new sets and costume designs by Jérôme Kaplan, winner of Benoir de la Danse, and guest appearances of Paris Opera Ballet principal dancer Hugo Marchand and The Royal Ballet principal dancer Marianela Nuñez and Matthew Ball. Dates: 30 May – 8 June 2025 Venue: Grand Theatre, Hong Kong Cultural Centre Jazz Female Duo – Paris Rendezvous Experience an enchanting performance by the talented jazz female duo – Joyce Cheung from Hong Kong and Sarah Lancman from France, who promise to deliver a captivating soundscape that weaves together the unique cultural heritage of jazz standards and French hits. Date: 6 June 2025 Venue: Concert Hall, Hong Kong City Hall Erik Truffaz – Rollin' & Clap! Follow trumpeter Erik Truffaz, one of the world's leading jazz stars, to the golden age of French cinema in a riveting performance of work by composers Nino Rota, Michel Magne, Ennio Morricone and Philippe Sarde. Joining him are his long-time accomplices Marcello Giuliani and musicians Raphaël Chassin, Alexis Anérilles and Matthis Pascaud. Discover the beauty of a sensitive homage that still shines in today's collective imagination! Date: 7 June 2025 Venue: Concert Hall, Hong Kong City Hall Echoes of the Heart Discover a rich cross-cultural musical performance delivered straight from the heart by Cantopop sensation Jay Fung and talented French singer Joyce Jonathan. Performed in Chinese, English and French, revel in the dynamic synergy of the two performers. Date: 14 June 2025 Venue: Concert Hall, Hong Kong Cultural Centre Souvenirs Co-produced by French May and Alliance Française de Hong Kong, catch the dance couple Claire Théault and Anthony Figueiredo of France's Got Talent fame live on stage as they take audiences on a journey through their memories in their luggage of life. A visual, poetic and choreographic performance mixing live shadows, dance and physical theatre. Dates: 14 – 15 June 2025 Venue: Theatre, Sheung Wan Civic Centre The Jockey Club Community Outreach and Arts Education Programmes Thanks to The Hong Kong Jockey Club Charities Trust, which is supporting the festival for the 14th consecutive year, French May is able to share the pleasures of French culture with the wider community. The Jockey Club Community Outreach and Arts Education Programmes – comprising outreach projects, educational talks, workshops, masterclasses and free performances – will enable a wider and more diverse audience to experience French arts and culture first hand. More detailed information for individual programmes and activities will be available in April. Please click here to download the high-resolution image. About the French May Arts Festival Established in 1993, French May is one of the largest cultural events in Asia. With about 100 programmes presented across two months, we showcase the most diversified art forms – from heritage and contemporary art, paintings and design to classical music and hip-hop dance, cinema and circus. It has become an iconic part of Hong Kong's cultural scene, reaching over 200,000 visitors each year. French May brings the arts to everyone, not only in cultural venues, but also in public spaces, shopping malls and more, inviting everyone across Hong Kong to enjoy art in their daily lives. With the aim of promoting accessible arts for all, French May places a strong emphasis on education through outreach programmes, guided tours, workshops, masterclasses and free performances. The festival strives to reach the widest possible audience and contribute to education of the young and less-privileged, working closely with over 50 local institutions and organisations to establish barrier-free access to the arts. Contact For further enquiries and requests for interviews, please contact: Occasions PR & Marketing Ltd. Stella Wong Email: stellawong@occasionspr.com Tel: +852 3678 0123 Cecilia Li Email: cecilia@occasionspr.com Tel: +852 3678 0135

results.title: HKGFA Launches Transition Planning Knowledge Repository to Aid Net-zero Goals, Offering Resources for Industry Practitioners in Hong Kong and Beyond
results.description: HONG KONG, March 12, 2025 /PRNewswire/ -- Hong Kong Green Finance Association (HKGFA) today launched the online Transition Planning Knowledge Repository (TPKR) (https://www.hkgreenfinance.org/transition-planning-repository/), providing industry practitioners with a toolkit of resources to help develop best-practice transition plans and facilitate access to necessary transition finance to support their net-zero goals. The TPKR is an ongoing initiative of the Transition Planning workstream under the HKGFA Banking – Financing the Transition Working Group. The TPKR consists of 5 principles, 4 core pillars, and 27 major components covering the essential elements required to develop a sound transition plan, with reference to the key components proposed by major tools and frameworks underpinning similar overarching elements, such as Task Force on Climate-Related Financial Disclosures (TCFD), International Sustainability Standards Board (ISSB), Glasgow Financial Alliance for Net Zero (GFANZ), and the UK Transition Plan Taskforce. Additionally, the TPKR collates case studies and guidelines from HKGFA members and the broader sustainable finance ecosystem, serving as practical references for those initiating their transition journey. Dr. Ma Jun, Chairman and President of HKGFA, said, "The launch of the TPKR is a pivotal moment for HKGFA and transition finance as we proudly present a much-needed tool to support financial institutions, asset managers, and corporates on their transition journeys. It collates a public archive of the key components necessary for a robust and credible transition plan, extracted from major frameworks and guidelines worldwide, thereby enabling innovative financing solutions and enhancing interoperability of taxonomies. I would like to express my appreciation to the HKGFA Banking Working Group and our members for their hard work and dedication to the development of the TPKR, and for their continued efforts in affirming Hong Kong's position as a global sustainable finance hub for a more resilient future." As the co-leader of the HKGFA Transition Planning workstream and Head of ESG Solutions, APAC at Mizuho Bank, Ms. Ivy Lau, added, "A 1.5°C world will not be possible without the private sectors' climate ambition, action, and capital. HKGFA's TPKR is designed for corporates and financial institutions in Hong Kong and the wider APAC region to facilitate their navigation of myriad climate transition resources and accelerate their formulation of credible transition plans, which is the pre-requisite for a quantum leap in transition finance." Many corporates and SMEs today face challenges posed by climate change and require considerable financial capital to achieve net-zero transition and effective risk mitigation. Having a well-structured transition plan is a crucial step to help them highlight areas for investment, that may be facilitated by financial institutions. "Knowledge sharing is a powerful driver for progress in the transition to a net-zero economy. The launch of the TPKR provides finance professionals, corporates, and SMEs with the resources they need to make greater progress towards their transition priorities.", said Ms. Alice Suen, HSBC Hong Kong's Head of Sustainable Finance and Investments and Co-Chair of HKGFA Banking – Financing the Transition Working Group. About Hong Kong Green Finance Association Founded in September 2018, Hong Kong Green Finance Association (HKGFA) provides a unique platform that supports the development of green finance and sustainable investments in Hong Kong and beyond. It aims to mobilise both public and private sector resources and talents in developing green finance policies, to promote green finance business and product innovation within financial institutions. The HKGFA's main goal is to position Hong Kong as a leading international green tech and green finance hub by providing greater access and opportunities for Hong Kong's financial institutions and corporates to participate in green financing transactions locally, in mainland China, and in markets along the Belt & Road. This is in line with the global path to implementing the UN Sustainable Development Goals and the Paris Agreement. HKGFA's key activities are organised through five working groups, namely Banking – Financing the Transition, Product Innovation and Solutions, Sustainability-related Disclosures, Policy and Standards, Greater Bay Area Green Finance Alliance, and Real Estate. HKGFA is a member of international platforms such as the Capacity Building Alliance of Sustainable Investment, the Global Capacity Building Coalition (GCBC), and the UNDP Financial Centre for Sustainability (FC4S). Please visit https://www.hkgreenfinance.org/ for more information. Media Contact: Ms. Flora Liu (Hong Kong Green Finance Association), info@hkgreenfinance.org

results.title: ارتفاع أرباح «سمايل كير» إلى 6.3 مليون ريال في 2024
creator: اليوم - الدمام
results.description: ارتفعت أرباح شركة بسمة أديم الطبية (سمايل كير) في عام 2024 بنسبة 6.3 مليون ريال، مقابل 4.9 مليون ريال في 2023.ووفقا لبيان الشركة على تداول السعودية، سجلت الشركة ارتفاعا في مجمل الربح بنسبة 31.97% ليصل إلى 11,012,656 ريال مقارنة بـ 8,344,755 ريال في العام السابق، بزيادة قدرها 2,667,901 ريال.ويعود هذا النمو بشكل رئيسي إلى ارتفاع الإيرادات مما انعكس إيجابياً على الأداء المالي.

results.title: مجلس إدارة «وسم» يوصي بتقليص مدة دورته الحالية إلى 4 سنوات
creator: اليوم - الدمام
results.description: أوصى مجلس إدارة شركة وسم الأعمال لتقنية المعلومات، أمس، بتقليص مدة عضوية مجلس الإدارة الحالي لتصبح أربع سنوات بدلاً من خمس سنوات وذلك بإنهاء دورة مجلس الإدارة الحالي والتي بدأت بتاريخ 21/09/2021م وتنتهي بتاريخ 20/09/2026م.ووفقا لبيان الشركة على تداول السعودية، يصبح تاريخ انتهاء دورة مجلس الإدارة الحالي في 20/09/2025م، إذ رأى المجلس إنهاء دورة مجلس الإدارة الحالي قبل أوانها وذلك لتتوافق مع نظام الشركات الجديد الصادر بالمرسوم الملكي الكريم رقم (م/132) وتاريخ 01/12/1443هـ وتماشياً مع النظام الأساس المحدث للشركة.وتصبح مدة دورة المجلس الحالي بالإضافة للدورات القادمة أربع سنوات، علماً بأن التوصية تخضع لموافقة المساهمين والتي سوف يتم رفعها للتصويت عليها في اجتماع الجمعية العامة القادم والذي سوف يحدد لاحقاً.
